question: In which cases is it a good idea to use the working directory?

answers.answer: When you want to access files and folders of the File System which branch below the working directory
answers.feedback: Exactly! In this case it is useful to start the path from the WD. We can see the WD as the root of a tree that can reach the files and folders you need.

answers.answer: When you want to access files and folders of the File System many branches above the working directory
answers.feedback: This can be done but it is not practical. If you need very often to access files above the WD, maybe you should consider changing your WD to a higher level of the FS.

answers.answer: When you share a folder containing all the material from a project.
answers.feedback: Yes! In this case, a person reproducing your project will set as WD the folder you shared, and all the paths will be relative to that folder.

answers.answer: When you need to access a project folder contained in /faststorage
answers.feedback: Not correct. You need an absolute path starting from /faststorage. Unless your WD is the /faststorage, or /faststorage/project/.
